intro: Anthyllis bicephalos, commonly known as the two-headed anthyllis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive two-headed appearance due to its clustered flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, pea-like flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds. Anthyllis bicephalos is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas.
